translated: Thus, by observing the body as a body, he, having understood the non-arising of the nature of the body, does not arouse the mental activity that is associated with the perception of the body.

original: yid la byed pa kun nas slong bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa kun nas slong bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: de lhag par byed pa dang bral zhing /

translated: and whose consciousness does not abide, although he cultivates the application of mindfulness that observes a body in the body, does not cultivate any dharma at all.

original: mi byed do //
analyzed: mi byed do //
translated: He does not destroy any dharma.

original: des chos thams cad dngos po med par rig nas lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na sems gang gis de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i sems de yang sgyu ma'i chos nyid dang / brag ca'i chos nyid lta bur rab tu shes so //

translated: When they know that all phenomena are unreal, and they abide in observing the body in the body, they know that the mind with which they abide in observing the body in the body is like an illusory phenomenon and like an echo.

original: de ltar rab tu shes pas bde ba'i tshor ba la yang rjes su chags pa med la /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu shes pas bde ba'i tshor ba la yang rjes su chags pa med la /
translated: Because they know this, they are not attached to pleasant feelings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la yang khong khro ba med cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la yang khong khro ba med cing /
translated: They are not averse to painful feelings.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la yang rmongs pa med pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la yang rmongs pa med pas /
translated: They are not confused about feelings that are neither painful nor pleasant.

original: ma rig pa bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not have ignorance lying in wait.

original: gang gi tshe tshor ba rnams kyis mi 'phrog pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshor ba rnams kyis mi 'phrog pa de ni /
translated: When they are not carried away by feelings,

analyzed: de'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: then they have mindfulness established in the body that observes feelings in feelings.

original: de de ltar tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na chos thams cad la tshor ba'i rgyu ba dag gis sems mi rgyu bas de chos thams cad la sems mi gnas pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems spong bar mi byed /🔽'dor bar mi byed /

translated: When they thus observe and abide in the pursuit of feelings, their minds do not pursue any phenomena through the pursuit of feelings. Therefore, they do not abandon the mind of awakening, nor do they reject any phenomena because their minds do not dwell on any phenomena.

original: yongs su gtong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: yongs su gtong bar mi byed de /
translated: When they are thus observing and attending to feelings, their minds do not move with the movements of feelings in relation to all phenomena. Therefore, they do not abandon, reject, or give up the mind of awakening in relation to all phenomena, because their minds do not dwell on any phenomena.

original: de ni / de'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / de'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is their close application of mindfulness that observes the mind in relation to the mind.

original: de chos shes pa mngon sum du gyur pas chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pas chos nyid la 'jug par byed cing /

original: lus dang / tshor @243b ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la 'du shes dang / yid la byed pa dang / lta ba dang / kun nas dkris pa dag gis gnas par mi byed de /

translated: They do not dwell on the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena with perceptions, attention, views, and entanglements.

original: de ni / de'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / de'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis ma byung zhing dngos po med pa dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid lta bur rtogs pas dris na /
analyzed: des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis ma byung zhing dngos po med pa dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid lta bur rtogs pas dris na /

analyzed: dran pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa brda sprod par byed de / lha'i bu / de ni /

analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: “Moreover, son of the gods, the bodhisattva’s right knowledge

analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems de la kun shes par byed /
translated: is the understanding of the mind of omniscience,

analyzed: rnam par rig par byed /
translated: the awareness of it,

analyzed: gnas par byed / mi spong bar byed /
translated: the stability in it,🔽the non-abandonment of it,

original: rnam par mi g-yeng bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng bar byed /
translated: and the non-distraction from it.

original: mi brjed par byed pa dang / dang por dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi thog mar 'gro ba dang / ser sna'i sems la mi 'jug pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems spong ba dang /🔽tshul khrims kyi phung po la gnas pa med pa dang / sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing rtsod pa med pa dang / lus dang ngag dang sems kyis rma mi 'byin pa dang / nyan @244a *//
analyzed: mi brjed par byed pa dang / dang por dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi thog mar 'gro ba dang / ser sna'i sems la mi 'jug pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems spong ba dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po la gnas pa med pa dang / sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing rtsod pa med pa dang / lus dang ngag dang sems kyis rma mi 'byin pa dang / nyan @244a *//
translated: It is to not forget. It is to be at the forefront of the roots of virtue. It is to not engage with miserly thoughts. It is to follow the complete giving away of all possessions. It is to abandon thoughts of faulty discipline.🔽It is to not abide in the aggregate of discipline. It is to not harm or quarrel with any being. It is to not cause any wounds with body, speech, or mind. It is to not make the effort of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa dang / theg pa chen po'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams yid la mi byed cing mi dran pa dang / bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la mi gnas par sgom pa dang /
analyzed: thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa dang / theg pa chen po'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams yid la mi byed cing mi dran pa dang / bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la mi gnas par sgom pa dang /
translated: It is to make the effort of the Great Vehicle. It is to not think about or remember nonvirtuous qualities. It is to meditate without abiding in any meditative concentration or meditative absorption.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad la mi rgyu ba dang / chos thams cad la 'phro bar mi byed pa dang / chos thams cad la rnam pa med par 'jug pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i rnam pa la 'jug pa dang / yul rnams la mi rgyu ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad la mi rgyu ba dang / chos thams cad la 'phro bar mi byed pa dang / chos thams cad la rnam pa med par 'jug pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i rnam pa la 'jug pa dang / yul rnams la mi rgyu ba dang /
translated: It is to not engage in any views. It is to not proliferate about any phenomena. It is to engage with all phenomena in a way that is free of aspects. It is to engage with the thoughts of beings. It is to not engage with objects.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye bo rnams dang ma 'dres pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las ma smad pa dang / bag yod pa lhur len cing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye bo rnams dang ma 'dres pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las ma smad pa dang / bag yod pa lhur len cing /
translated: It is to follow the noble ones. It is to not mix with those who are not noble. It is to have blameless physical, verbal, and mental actions. It is to be dedicated to carefulness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba dang / bstang mi dgos par dgos pa thams cad nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug spangs pas rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims la skyon med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba dang / bstang mi dgos par dgos pa thams cad nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug spangs pas rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims la skyon med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa dang /
translated: It is to seek the qualities of the buddhas. It is to be without pretense. It is to be pure through having abandoned desire, anger, and ignorance. It is to be without torment because one’s discipline is flawless.

original: log par zhugs pa rnams dang ma 'brel pa dang / nang shin tu dag pas tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pas kha gsag med pa dang / rang gi rnyed @244b pas chog shes pas tshol ba med pa dang /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa rnams dang ma 'brel pa dang / nang shin tu dag pas tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pas kha gsag med pa dang / rang gi rnyed @244b pas chog shes pas tshol ba med pa dang /
translated: They do not associate with those who have entered wrong paths. They are not hypocritical because their inner being is completely pure. They are not deceitful because their verbal actions are completely pure. They do not seek out gain because they are content with their own possessions.

original: 'tsho ba ngan pa rnam par spangs pas thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / ngan don tsam gyis chog shes pas rnam par g-ye ba med pa dang / khams gsum la 'dun pa dang bral bas 'dod pa chung ba dang / sdig pa 'dod pa dang bral bas chog shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba ngan pa rnam par spangs pas thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / ngan don tsam gyis chog shes pas rnam par g-ye ba med pa dang / khams gsum la 'dun pa dang bral bas 'dod pa chung ba dang / sdig pa 'dod pa dang bral bas chog shes pa dang /
translated: They do not make demands because they have abandoned wrong livelihood. They are not fickle because they are content with just the bare necessities. They have few desires because they are free from longing for the three realms. They are content because they are free from desire for evil.

original: chos thams cad dben par mos pas dben pa dang 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa spangs pas don nyung ba dang / spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcas pas spros pa med pa dang / 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben par mos pas dben pa dang 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa spangs pas don nyung ba dang / spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcas pas spros pa med pa dang / 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'jigs pa dang /
translated: They are secluded because they are convinced that all phenomena are isolated. They have few concerns because they have abandoned worldly activities. They are free of conceptual elaboration because they have eliminated all conceptual elaboration. They are free of desire, anger, fear, and ignorance because they have abandoned the mental afflictions.

original: gti mug dang bral bas 'gro ba med pa dang / nga rgyal nges par bcom pas chos la dga' ba dang / sems shin tu dul bas cang shes pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po kun tu srung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos sems gnas pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral bas 'gro ba med pa dang / nga rgyal nges par bcom pas chos la dga' ba dang / sems shin tu dul bas cang shes pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po kun tu srung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos sems gnas pa med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free from delusion and thus to be without going. It is to be delighted by the Dharma because one’s pride has been destroyed. It is to be self-controlled because one’s mind is well trained. It is to guard the aggregate of correct conduct. It is to have a mind that is not distracted because of the aggregate of absorption.

original: shes rab kyi phung pos sems rnam par grol ba dang / 'phags pa'i rigs mi 'dor ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la dam bcas pa ma nyams pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti thams cad don du mi gnyer ba dang / sems can pha rol dag gi ngor byed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung pos sems rnam par grol ba dang / 'phags pa'i rigs mi 'dor ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la dam bcas pa ma nyams pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti thams cad don du mi gnyer ba dang / sems can pha rol dag gi ngor byed pa med pa dang /
translated: It is to have a mind that is liberated because of the aggregate of insight. It is to never abandon the family of the noble ones. It is to never break one’s vow to attain awakening. It is to never pursue any gain or honor. It is to never be concerned with the faces of others.

original: gzhan kun tu bsrung ba'i phyir bdag rjes su srung ba dang / rang gi sems la nges par sems pas gzhan gyi 'khrul pa rnams mi tshol ba dang / tshul khrims legs par bsdams @245a *//
analyzed: gzhan kun tu bsrung ba'i phyir bdag rjes su srung ba dang / rang gi sems la nges par sems pas gzhan gyi 'khrul pa rnams mi tshol ba dang / tshul khrims legs par bsdams @245a *//
translated: It is to guard oneself in order to protect others. It is to never look for the mistakes of others because one is focused on one’s own mind. It is to be well restrained in one’s correct conduct.

original: pas 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pas chos kyi bgo bsha' byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams rjes su srung ba dang / dang por dge ba'i chos thams cad la thog mar 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: pas 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pas chos kyi bgo bsha' byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams rjes su srung ba dang / dang por dge ba'i chos thams cad la thog mar 'gro ba dang /
translated: It is to be free from all fear. It is to share the Dharma without being stingy with the teacher’s instructions. It is to protect the mental conduct of all beings. It is to be foremost in all virtuous qualities.

original: chos thams cad ro gcig pas spyod pa tha dad pa med pa dang / rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pas rlom sems med pa dang / skye ba med par yang so sor rtog la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du skye ba yang yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ro gcig pas spyod pa tha dad pa med pa dang / rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pas rlom sems med pa dang / skye ba med par yang so sor rtog la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du skye ba yang yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is to have no different conduct because all phenomena are of one taste. It is to be without conceit because all conceit has been destroyed. It is to be discerning with regard to nonarising while still taking birth intentionally in order to ripen beings.

original: chos thams cad la gzod ma nas stong pa nyid du yang so sor rtog la lta ba thams cad gdul ba'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par yang byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa yongs su 'dris par yang byed la mtshan ma la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la yang lta ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la gzod ma nas stong pa nyid du yang so sor rtog la lta ba thams cad gdul ba'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par yang byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa yongs su 'dris par yang byed la mtshan ma la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la yang lta ba dang /
translated: They are familiar with the absence of marks, yet they look after beings who engage in the practice of marks.🔽They have no aspirations or thoughts, yet they fulfill all aspirations for the sake of omniscient wisdom.

original: smon pa'i shes pa yang med la; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyir smon lam thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yang so sor rtog la dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya bas kyang ngoms mi myong ba dang /
analyzed: smon pa'i shes pa yang med la; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyir smon lam thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yang so sor rtog la dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya bas kyang ngoms mi myong ba dang /
translated: They discern the absence of conditioning, yet they are never satisfied with the conditioning of roots of virtue.

original: bdud kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pas lam ma yin pa'i lam dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang ma 'dres pas spyod pa ma yin pa spyod pa dang / chos thams cad la rtog pas gdeg pa med cing gzhag pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pas lam ma yin pa'i lam dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang ma 'dres pas spyod pa ma yin pa spyod pa dang / chos thams cad la rtog pas gdeg pa med cing gzhag pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang /

original: gzhan la lhag par rlom sems su mi byed pas bdag mi sgrog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs pas shes pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gag par bzod pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ste /

translated: It is the non-proclaiming of self, for it does not arrogantly think of others. It is the sameness of knowledge that is not equal to the buddhas’ qualities. It is the acceptance of the unborn nature of phenomena, for it is the acceptance of all phenomena as unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa yin no //

translated: “Moreover, Pāpīyān, when a bodhisattva, without regard for inner and outer things, gives away all his possessions with the altruistic mind of awakening,

analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas nges par byung ba yin no //
translated: he has gone forth through the perfection of wisdom.

translated: one has gone forth through the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa yin no //

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas nges par byung ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas nges par byung ba yin no //
translated: he has gone forth through the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sdig can / khyod kyis ni /
analyzed: sdig can / khyod kyis ni /
translated: “Evil one, you have attained

analyzed: khyod ni / sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi mtshan dang ldan zhing sengge'i khri la 'dug go /

analyzed: 'jam dpal / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang byang chub la brnyes na /

analyzed: thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas na /

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa thob pa yin no //

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba dang / byang chub ni /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i mthas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba dang / byang chub ni /

translated: Awakening is the very essence of selflessness, the very essence of the absence of sentient beings, the very essence of the absence of life-force, the very essence of the absence of nourishment, the very essence of the absence of human being, and the very essence of the absence of person.

original: de la ni /

translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva hears this teaching on the defining characteristic of awakening and does not disturb the defining characteristic of the essence of all phenomena,

analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: bdud kyi bstan pa 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgyas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //

translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is amazing that through your blessing the evil Māra has taken on the color and form of the Tathāgata and, sitting on a lion throne, teaches these profound topics.

original: ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: ngo mtshar to //

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / kho bos ni /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽if I were to bless these inanimate things—wood, grass, and forest—

translated: in such a way, they too would take on such characteristics and teach the Dharma with the eloquence of a buddha.”

analyzed: kho bos gnas brtan sh'a radva ti'i bu nyid la de lta de ltar byin gyis brlabs na yang gnas brtan sh'a radva ti'i bu yang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi spobs pas chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: I have blessed the elder Śāradvatī­putra in such a way that the elder Śāradvatī­putra, endowed with the form and marks of a buddha, will teach the Dharma with the eloquence of a buddha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra thought,

original: bdag kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan par byin gyis brlabs nas nyan thos ston pa'i gzugs su gnas pa ni /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan par byin gyis brlabs nas nyan thos ston pa'i gzugs su gnas pa ni /
translated: “I, too, have been blessed by the youthful Mañjuśrī to have the form and marks of a buddha, but to teach the Dharma in the form of a śrāvaka.

original: mi mthun pa yin pas bdag 'khor 'di nas mi snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa yin pas bdag 'khor 'di nas mi snang bar bya'o //

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan zhing sengge'i khri la 'dug par thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams kyis mthong bar byin gyis brlabs so //🔽de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i @264a *//
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan zhing sengge'i khri la 'dug par thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams kyis mthong bar byin gyis brlabs so // de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i @264a *//
translated: Then, the youthful Mañjuśrī, knowing the thoughts of the venerable Śāradvatīputra, blessed the venerable Śāradvatīputra to appear in the form of a buddha, endowed with the major marks of a buddha, seated on a lion throne, so that the entire assembly could see him.

original: bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, the youthful Mañjuśrī said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par mdzad pa de bzhin du bdud sdig can dang lhan cig tu ston cig /

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan pas bdud sdig can sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan pas bdud sdig can sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sku'i mtshan dang ldan pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra, having taken on the form and marks of a buddha, said to Māra, the evil one, who had taken on the form and marks of a buddha:

original: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub ni /
analyzed: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub ni /
translated: “Evil one, the enlightenment of the tathāgatas

original: ci zhig gis rab tu phye ba yin /
analyzed: ci zhig gis rab tu phye ba yin /

original: smras pa / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ni /

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //

analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis su med par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi dbang bskur bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi dbang bskur bas rab tu phye ba yin no //

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //

analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa thams cad rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //

original: dngos po rnam par 'jig pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'jig pas rab tu phye ba yin no //

original: sgom pa dang dngos po med pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: sgom pa dang dngos po med pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: It is distinguished by the meditation on things and nonthings.

original: rab tu phye ba yang ma yin /🔽rab tu ma phye ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab tu phye ba yang ma yin / rab tu ma phye ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not distinguished.🔽It is not undistinguished.

original: rgyu ba med pa /
analyzed: rgyu ba med pa /

original: rgyu ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: rgyu ba dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from movement.

original: rgyu ba @264b thams cad yang dag par chad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ba @264b thams cad yang dag par chad pa ste /
translated: It is the complete cessation of all movement.

original: 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med pa yin no //

original: de nas bdud sdig can gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: The venerable Śāradvatīputra said,

original: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: “Evil one, the Tathāgata

original: 'khor ba mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: dwells in the equality of saṃsāra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rlom sems med pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rlom sems med pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He abides in the absence of conceit regarding nirvāṇa.

analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He abides in the characteristic of the nature of all views.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnas la gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas la gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis su med pa'i gnas la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He abides in the basis of the nonduality of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: gnas thams cad la mi gnas pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas thams cad la mi gnas pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: He abides in the basis of not abiding in any basis.

original: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: Māra, the Tathāgata

original: de lta bu la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus yang bdud sdig can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Śāradvatīputra then said to the evil Māra,

analyzed: sdig can / byang chub ga las btsal bar bya /
translated: “Māra, where should you search for enlightenment?”

original: bdud kyis smras pa /
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa /
translated: Māra said,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu; byang chub ni /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu; byang chub ni /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, enlightenment

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gnas pa dang / ma rig pa dang srid pa'i sred pa kun tu sbyor ba dang / phyin ci log gis kun nas dkris pa dang / sgrib pa dang / @265a *//
translated: It is to be based in the view of the transitory collection, to be fettered by ignorance and craving for existence, to be entangled by error, and to be obscured.🔽

original: chod pa dag las btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: chod pa dag las btsal bar bya'o //
translated: They should be sought in the view of the transitory collection, in the fetters of ignorance and craving for existence, in the entanglements of error, and in the obscurations and obstructions.🔽Kāśyapa, those are the four things that bodhisattvas should seek.”

original: smras pa / sdig can /
analyzed: smras pa / sdig can /
translated: “Evil one,

original: khyed ci las bsam ste de skad ston /
analyzed: khyed ci las bsam ste de skad ston /
translated: what are you thinking when you teach this?”

original: smras pa / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //
